de.mrapp.android.adapter

Interface RecyclerViewAdapter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Adapter<android.widget.AbsListView>, java.lang.Cloneable, DataStructure, Loggable, Parameterizable, Restorable, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ListAdapter<DataType>, MultipleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, NoChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, SelectableListAdapter<DataType>, SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEnableStateListAdapter, AbstractFilterableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateListAdapter, AbstractListAdapter, AbstractSelectableListAdapter, AbstractSortableListAdapter, MultipleChoiceListAdapterImplementation, NoChoiceListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation

    public interface RecyclerViewAdapter
extends Adapter<android.widget.AbsListView>
    Defines the interface, all adapters, which can be attached to a RecyclerView, must implement.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  RecyclerViewAdapter.ListItemViewHolder
      The view holder, which is used by a RecyclerViewAdapter.

    • Method Detail

      • attach

        void attach(@NonNull
            android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView adapterView)
        Attaches the adapter to a view.
        Parameters:
        adapterView - The view, the adapter should be attached to, as an instance of the class RecyclerView. The view may not be null

      • notifyItemChanged

        void notifyItemChanged(int index)
        Notifies any registered observers that the item at index has changed. Equivalent to calling notifyItemChanged(index, null);.

        This is an item change event, not a structural change event. It indicates that any reflection of the data at index is out of date and should be updated. The item at index retains the same identity.

        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, which has been changed, as an Integer value
        See Also:
        notifyItemRangeChanged(int, int)

      • notifyItemChanged

        void notifyItemChanged(int index,
                       java.lang.Object payload)
        Notifies any registered observers that the item at index has changed with an optional payload object.

        This is an item change event, not a structural change event. It indicates that any reflection of the data at index is out of date and should be updated. The item at index retains the same identity.

        The client can optionally pass a payload for partial change. These payloads will be merged and may be passed to the adapter's onBindViewHolder-method, if the item is already represented by a view holder and it will be rebound to the same view holder. Calling the notifyItemRangeChanged-method with null payload will clear all existing payloads on that item and prevent future payload until the onBindViewHolder-method is called. Adapters should not assume that the payload will always be passed to the onBindViewHolder-method, e.g. when the view is not attached, the payload will be simply dropped.

        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, which has been changed, as an Integer value
        payload - An optional payload as an instance of the class Object or null to identify a "full" update
        See Also:
        notifyItemRangeChanged(int, int)

      • notifyItemRangeChanged

        void notifyItemRangeChanged(int startIndex,
                            int itemCount)
        Notifies any registered observers that the itemCount items starting at startIndex have changed. Equivalent to calling notifyItemRangeChanged(startIndex, itemCount, null);.

        This is an item change event, not a structural change event. It indicates that any reflection of the data in the given position range is out of date and should be updated. The items in the given range retain the same identity.

        Parameters:
        startIndex - The index of the first item, which has been changed, as an Integer value
        itemCount - The number of items, which have been changed, as an Integer value. The number of items must be at least 1
        See Also:
        notifyItemChanged(int)

      • notifyItemRangeChanged

        void notifyItemRangeChanged(int startIndex,
                            int itemCount,
                            java.lang.Object payload)
        Notifies any registered observers that the itemCount items starting at startIndex have changed. An optional payload can be passed to each changed item.

        This is an item change event, not a structural change event. It indicates that any reflection of the data in the given position range is out of date and should be updated. The items in the given range retain the same identity.

        The client can optionally pass a payload for partial change. These payloads will be merged and may be passed to the adapter's onBindViewHolder-method, if the item is already represented by a view holder and it will be rebound to the same view holder. Calling the notifyItemRangeChanged-method with null payload will clear all existing payloads on that item and prevent future payload until the onBindViewHolder-method is called. Adapters should not assume that the payload will always be passed to the onBindViewHolder-method, e.g. when the view is not attached, the payload will be simply dropped.

        Parameters:
        startIndex - The index of the first item, which has been changed, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        itemCount - The number of items, which have been changed, as an Integer value
        payload - An optional payload as an instance of the class Object or null to identify a "full" update
        See Also:
        notifyItemChanged(int)

      • notifyItemInserted

        void notifyItemInserted(int index)
        Notifies any registered observers that the item at index has been newly inserted. The item previously at index is now at index + 1.

        This is a structural change event. Representations of other existing items in the data set are still considered up to date and will not be rebound, though their positions may be altered.

        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, which has been inserted, as an Integer value
        See Also:
        notifyItemRangeInserted(int, int)

      • notifyItemMoved

        void notifyItemMoved(int fromIndex,
                     int toIndex)
        Notifies any registered observers that the item reflected at fromIndex has been moved to toIndex.

        This is a structural change event. Representations of other existing items in the data set are still considered up to date and will not be rebound, though their positions may be altered.

        Parameters:
        fromIndex - The previous index of the item, as an Integer value
        toIndex - The new index of the item as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

      • notifyItemRangeInserted

        void notifyItemRangeInserted(int startIndex,
                             int itemCount)
        Notifies any registered observers that the currently reflected itemCount items starting at startIndex have been newly inserted. The items previously located at startIndex and beyond can now be found starting at startIndex + itemCount.

        This is a structural change event. Representations of other existing items in the data set are still considered up to date and will not be rebound, though their positions may be altered.

        Parameters:
        startIndex - The index of the first item, which has been inserted, as an Integer value
        itemCount - The number of items, which have been inserted, as an Integer value. The number of items must at least 1
        See Also:
        notifyItemInserted(int)

      • notifyItemRemoved

        void notifyItemRemoved(int index)
        Notifies any registered observers that the item previously located at index has been removed from the data set. The items previously located at and after index may now be found at the oldIndex - 1.

        This is a structural change event. Representations of other existing items in the data set are still considered up to date and will not be rebound, though their positions may be altered.

        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, which has been removed, as an Integer value
        See Also:
        notifyItemRangeRemoved(int, int)

      • notifyItemRangeRemoved

        void notifyItemRangeRemoved(int positionStart,
                            int itemCount)
        Notifies any registered observers that the itemCount items previously located at startIndex have been removed from the data set. The items previously located at and after startIndex + itemCount may now be found at oldIndex - itemCount.

        This is a structural change event. Representations of other existing items in the data set are still considered up to date and will not be rebound, though their positions may be altered.

        Parameters:
        positionStart - The previous index of the first item, which has been removed, as an Integer value
        itemCount - The number of items, which has been removed, as an Integer value. The number of items must be at least 1

      • clone

        RecyclerViewAdapter clone()
                   throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Description copied from interface: DataStructure
        Creates and returns a deep copy of the object.
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Adapter<android.widget.AbsListView>
        Specified by:
        clone in interface DataStructure
        Returns:
        A deep copy of the object as an instance of the class Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException - The exception, which is thrown, if cloning is not supported
